JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;Erik Møse;Julia Laffranque;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicants are of NORP origin . They had a specially protected tenancy on a flat in GPE in which the first applicant lived until DATE and the second applicant until DATE , when they left GPE and went to live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG Attorney ’s ORG ( Općinsko državno odvjetništvo u GPE ) , on behalf of GPE , brought a civil action against the applicants in ORG ( PERSON ) , seeking termination of their tenancy on the grounds that the applicants had been absent from the flat for DATE without any justified reason , and that their address was unknown .
CARDINAL . After an attempt to serve a summons on the applicants failed , ORG appointed lawyer PERSON to represent them before the court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG terminated the applicants’ specially protected tenancy by a judgment which became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a request for the reopening of the proceedings with ORG . On DATE ORG granted the request and set aside its judgment of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE that court again terminated the applicants’ specially protected tenancy , finding that the applicants had failed to provide a convincing explanation for leaving the flat at issue and for remaining passive for DATE before trying to seek information about the status of their tenancy . The applicants lodged an appeal with ORG ( Županijski sud u GPE ) , which upheld the first - instance judgment on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a constitutional complaint before ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) about the termination of their specially protected tenancy and claiming that they had been discriminated against . On DATE ORG dismissed their constitutional complaint as ill - founded . The decision of ORG was served on the applicants on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged a request for housing with ORG ( ORG regionalnog razvoja , šumarstva i vodnog gospodarstva ) and were granted a flat in GPE measuring QUANTITY .
CARDINAL . The applicants complained about the size of the flat . On DATE they were granted another flat in ORG , near GPE , measuring QUANTITY , but they again refused to accept it .

CARDINAL . NORP In the meantime , on DATE the applicants lodged a civil action in ORG against GPE , seeking damages and asking that their right to occupy and to acquire ownership of the flat on which they had had the specially protected tenancy be established .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants complained before ORG about the length of the proceedings . On DATE ORG instructed the applicants that the complaints about the length of the proceedings fell within the competence of the lower courts and ORG ( PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants complained to ORG about the length of the proceedings before ORG . On DATE ORG declared their complaint inadmissible on the ground that they had failed to appoint a representative to receive mail on their behalf in GPE , as required under the relevant domestic rules of procedure , since they lived abroad .
CARDINAL . The civil proceedings before ORG are still pending .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged an application with the ORG complaining about the termination of their specially protected tenancy and the fairness of the proceedings before ORG . They relied on LAW , taken alone and in conjunction with LAW . They also relied on LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE a committee of CARDINAL judges of the ORG declared the applicant ’s application inadmissible as incompatible with the provisions of the LAW ratione temporis .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants again lodged an application with the ORG , complaining under LAW about the termination of their tenancy . They also complained under LAW No . CARDINAL that by terminating their tenancy the domestic authorities had prevented them from purchasing the flat at issue on favourable terms . The applicants further complained under LAW , taken in conjunction with LAW , that their tenancy had been terminated because of their NORP origin . Lastly , the applicants complained under LAW about the outcome of the civil proceedings in respect of the termination of their specially protected tenancy before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE a committee of CARDINAL judges of the ORG declared the applicant ’s application inadmissible as incompatible ratione materiae in the part concerning the applicant ’s property complaint , and substantively the same in the part concerning their other complaints .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant , acting on his own behalf and on behalf of the second applicant and their son PERSON , submitted a communication to ORG in GPE under LAW to LAW . He complained that the termination of the specially protected tenancy had , inter alia , violated their rights under LAW ( the right to equality before the courts and to a fair hearing ) , CARDINAL ( the right to a home ) , and CARDINAL ( prohibition of discrimination ) of the LAW . He also invoked LAW ( respect for human rights and effective domestic remedy ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE set out its views in communication no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL . It found that the termination of the applicants’ specially protected tenancy amounted to a violation of LAW taken in conjunction with LAW , and LAW taken in conjunction with LAW , and that there was no need to consider the question of a separate violation of LAW .
